context_of_use: This use case allows admins to manage user accounts to control system access.
description: Allows admins to create, update, deactivate, and delete user accounts and manage access.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
assumptions: Admin has the necessary permissions to manage user accounts.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to create user accounts.
The system shall allow admins to update user accounts.
The system shall allow admins to deactivate user accounts.
The system shall allow admins to delete user accounts.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific user account attributes that can be managed.
main_flow: 1. Admin selects the option to manage user accounts → System displays user management interface.
2. Admin chooses to authenticate → System prompts for admin credentials.
3. Admin enters credentials → System verifies credentials.
4. Admin selects to create, update, deactivate, or delete a user account → System performs the selected action.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If credentials are invalid, System displays an error message and prompts for re-entry.
